data.title: FixedSpatialMaterial only has Albedo and Specular properties
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Linux, git master

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

FixedSpatialMaterial only shows Albedo and Specular paramater; the other textures (AO, emission, rim, clearcoat, normal, ...) are all gone in the latest git version.

**Steps to reproduce:**

Create a FixedSpatialMaterial and check the properties editor.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: More fixes to Joypad renaming.
data.body:
Windows did not compile anymore because `DI8DEVTYPE_JOYPAD` isn't defined in the directx headers ^^
I also did the same renaming as in #7473 for the windows platform and reverted the changes in the gamepad mappings.

data.title: Fix include path for builtin libpng.
data.body:
Previously, this only added the libpng directory to the include path for the local (cloned) env.
So the rest of the codebase still tried to use the system headers when building with `builtin_libpng=yes`.

data.title: Rename "joypad_linux" class to "JoypadLinux"
data.body: Since all this refactoring is going on, I took the opportunity to rename this class in `GodotCase` so it fits with the rest of the codebase.

data.title: NixOS - Godot fat X11 binary will only display empty window with no rendered content.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
NixOS 16.09 - Godot 2.1.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Created a NixOS package around a generated Godot X11 fat binary (non-fat binaries won't even run), but I only get an empty window.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Make an X11 fat binary and then create a NixOS package around it (in my case, I just exported the "shader materials" demo). Linked ticket with in-depth description below.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/issues/21743

data.title: Added missing node icons, plus some icon changes
fix custom scene arguments from the editor
data.body:
sequel of #7347

Play edited scene and Play custom scene didn't worked when main_run_args
hadn't $scene as argument.

Changes/Fixes the way how the editor handles scene paths when starting the
project/a scene
Play the project - no scene path
Play the edited scene - scene path of active scene in the editor
Play custom scene - scene path of custom scene

main_arg_runs is now empty by default and $scene won't be replaced
by the scene path anymore

Changed declaration if EditorRun::run, to remove a unused value

data.title: Errors shown in console are difficult to track down
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
All OS with console output, all versions

**Issue description**
The error output in console makes it very difficult to track down, where the error lies.
An example is the error:
` ERROR: JacobianEntrySW: Condition ' m_Adiag <= real_t(0.0) ' is true.`

Instead of telling the user, which property in which object caused that error, it references some part of the godot source code.
For basic users, looking at the source code isn't an option, and even advanced users will likely have difficulties to find out, how the configuration of an object in the scene might have caused that error somewhere in code.
This leads to people just ignoring those errors, which makes the messages useless.

data.title: Fix codeblock tag in classes.xml for EditorSettings
data.body:
http://docs.godotengine.org/en/stable/classes/class_editorsettings.html?highlight=EditorSettings#member-function-description

codeblock tag is currently not working for there.

data.title: [Master] Failure to compile using Clang 3.8.1.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 16.10 64-bit, Godot 3.0 from master branch (as of latest pull).

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Unable to compile using Clang 3.8.1 as it gives an error:
```
clang++ -o drivers/unix/rw_lock_posix.x11.tools.64.llvm.o -c -g2 -Wall -DDEBUG_ENABLED -DDEBUG_MEMORY_ENABLED -DFREETYPE_ENABLED -DDEBUG_MEMORY_ALLOC -DSCI_NAMESPACE -DENABLE_DEPRECATED -DTYPED_METHOD_BIND -DOPENGL_ENABLED -DALSA_ENABLED -DJOYDEV_ENABLED -DPULSEAUDIO_ENABLED -DX11_ENABLED -DUNIX_ENABLED -DGLES2_ENABLED -DGLES_OVER_GL -DTOOLS_ENABLED -DGDSCRIPT_ENABLED -DMINIZIP_ENABLED -DXML_ENABLED -DGLAD_ENABLED -DGLES_OVER_GL -D_REENTRANT -Icore -Icore/math -Itools -Idrivers -I. -Iplatform/x11 -I/usr/include/freetype2 -I/usr/include/libpng16 -I/usr/include/alsa -Ithirdparty/glad drivers/unix/rw_lock_posix.cpp
drivers/unix/rw_lock_posix.cpp:66:9: error: expected expression
        rwlock=PTHREAD_RWLOCK_INITIALIZER;
               ^
/usr/include/pthread.h:133:3: note: expanded from macro 'PTHREAD_RWLOCK_INITIALIZER'
  { { 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, __PTHREAD_RWLOCK_ELISION_EXTRA, 0, 0 } }
  ^
1 error generated.
```

**Steps to reproduce:**
Compile Godot using use_llvm=yes.

data.title: CollisionPolygon2D Issues
data.body:
Windows 7 Godot 2.1/2.2

CollisionPolygon2D/set_polygon() does nothing

**Steps to reproduce:**
1-Get the polygon:
col = get_polygon()

2-Change the CollisionPolygon2D's shapes :
col[1].y=-80
3- set the polygon:
set_polygon(col)
**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B3mjAjcuXnKqVjFPanUycHhiaXc

according to docs seems to be possible to compile for web:

but

$ scons platform=javascript tools=no target=release
scons: Reading SConscript files ...
No valid target platform selected.

        server

        windows

clone head git
scons platform=javascript tools=no target=release

data.title: expose OS.set_exit_code and OS.get_exit_code to ClassDB
data.body: fixes #7459

data.title: Tile map editor oversizes the GUI width
data.body:
macOS Sierra on MacBook Pro Retina 13" - Godot 2.1.1

When I select a TileMap node, the TileMap editor opens, making the right part of the Godot GUI disappear out of the window.

If I enlarge the window, making it larger than my screen width, the rightest part of the GUI is shown.

The only way to make it return to a normal state is to de-select the TileMap node and to resize manually the Godot window, forcing the UI to refresh.

![bug_recording](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4479527/21742898/7cc6625e-d4f8-11e6-9f8a-2142f8e165a2.gif)

data.title: Compilation errors when tools=no
data.body:
Compiling the master branch with tools=no gives compilation errors such as:
scene/3d/baked_light_instance.cpp:1698:18: error: no member named 'get_edited_scene_root' in 'SceneTree'

There are also a number of errors that popup around rid.h and compiler directives.

Note that I've fixed them in PR #7457 as I ran into them while fixing compilation errors for iOS.

data.title: Export OS.set_exit_code in GDscript
data.body:
I'm wondering why `OS.set_exit_code` method is not available through GDScript. Did I missed it somewhere ?

I think this should be important for test frameworks which need to return non-zero value in case of failed test.

data.title: Fix #7455 - script text editor's right click menu being weird
data.body: @akien-mga Would be a nice thing to backport to 2.2 as well.

data.title: Working on compile issues for iOS
_enum_values warning
ScriptEditor - Right Click Menu broken
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux - current master

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The options when opening the right click menu in the script editor don't do what they say:
`Select All` deletes the line of the cursor or the current selection
`Paste` undos
`Undo` does nothing?
etc...

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open a script, right-click inside the text editor and choose `Select All`, this should delete a line.

data.title: Godot 2.1.1 needs libpng12 to run
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 16.10, fresh install - Godot 2.1.1 Stable

**Issue description** 
When trying to run Godot, throws error on console:
`error while loading shared libraries: libpng12.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory`

Was expected to run fine with libpng16 installed.

Everything works after installing a libpng12 from not official sources.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Try to run Godot without libpng12 installed (not available in Ubuntu 16.10 repositories).

Godot 2.1.0 Stable runs fine without libpng12.

os : manjoro - godot 2.2 beta


i compile it from source with this code "scons platform=x11"
when i want to lunch editor give this error:  

"
ERROR: initialize: Could not obtain an OpenGL 3.3 context!
   At: platform/x11/context_gl_x11.cpp:160.
ERROR: initialize: Error initializing GLAD
   At: drivers/gles3/rasterizer_gles3.cpp:136.

data.title: Consistent order of Property sections in the Inspector view
data.body:
We spend a lot of time looking for the value we need to change in the Inspector because the order is changing depending on the Node you select. So if you want to change the Opacity it's placed on top in Node2d but in the Label node its at the bottom. It cost time when you have to look in different places for the values you need. In Cocos Creator and Unity they have placed "the most important" properties at the top and they never move. 

**Solution: We suggest to always have the transform and opacity properties at the top in the inspector**

Example:
![godotconsistentui](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24936603/21721076/dcafefaa-d426-11e6-8cbb-9afa2a2f2fc4.jpg)


/Sorry for bulk adding issues, but we have been collecting a bit :)

data.title: Highlight Assets in the FileSystem when they are selected in the inspector
data.body:
When selecting an asset (this could be an image file) in the inspector it should navigate to the file in the FileSystem view and give it a quick highlight. This is a functionality I really like in unity and I think it provides a great way of navigating your project and finding files easy and fast. 

Example image:
![godotassetselection](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24936603/21719700/68dbbca0-d41f-11e6-9592-397210c484d1.jpg)

data.title: Remove Warning message when creating a new track in Animation window
data.body:
In my opinion there's no reason why you would give a warning message every time you want to create a new track in your animation. As a graphics guy doing a lot of animations this warning message becomes really annoying. It's like asking in Photoshop "if you really want to create a new layer." 

If you accidentally hit the wrong key button when setting a keyframe, then you can easily remove the track from the animation, so it's hard to see the need for the warning message.

data.title: Remove a folder in the FileSystem by pressing the Delete button
data.body:
I have often selected a folder in the FileSystem view and pressed the delete button, resulting in a node that was selected in the Scene view was deleted instead. 

**Solution**
When selecting a folder in the FileSystem, the Filesystem window should "take focus" and it should be possible to press the delete button to remove a folder. A warning message would be highly appreciated here. Like "Are you sure you want to remove this folder, you cannot undo this action."
